title: Meghan Markle Shares Never-Before-Seen Photo Of Archie On Prince Harry's Birthday
text:
From ELLE

Meghan Markle has paid tribute to her husband Prince Harry on his 35th birthday by sharing a never-before-seen photograph on Instagram of their son, Archie.

To celebrate the royal’s big day on Sunday, the Duchess of Sussex posted a grid of nine photographs of Prince Harry over the years including images of him as a baby with the late Princess Diana, his older brother Prince William, on his wedding day and their first trip overseas to New Zealand as a newlywed.

However, fans of the pair were eager to spot that Markle had also posted a black and white photo of herself, Prince Harry and Archie on the baby’s christening day in July.

In the caption of the post, a messages reads: ‘Wishing a very happy birthday to His Royal Highness Prince Harry, The Duke of Sussex! A birthday message from The Duchess of Sussex: “Your service to the causes you care so deeply for inspires me every day. You are the best husband and most amazing dad to our son. We love you. Happiest birthday!”’

The post has since been liked over 265,000 at the time of writing this article and inundated with comments from the royals’ followers who have shared their birthday wishes to the Prince and joy at seeing a new photo of Archie.

‘That picture of Harry kneeling in front of Meghan, and Archie! Beautiful beyond words,’ commented one user.

Another added: ‘New picture of Archie. Thank you for posting he’s so adorable!’

The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge also sent a birthday message to Prince Harry via their personal Instagram account, @kensingtonroyal.

‘Wishing a very happy birthday to The Duke of Sussex today!’ a caption, accompanying an image of the brothers on Harry’s wedding day last May, reads.

Last month, Prince Harry posted a birthday message on Instagram to his wife to celebrate her 38th birthday.

‘Wishing HRH The Duchess of Sussex a very Happy Birthday,’ the birthday post began.

‘“Happy Birthday to my amazing wife. Thank you for joining me on this adventure!” - Love, H.’
